content: Who was the first African-American woman to win an Academy Award for Best Actress, doing so in 2001 for her role in "Monster's Ball"?

Halle Berry was the first African-American woman to win an Academy Award for Best Actress. She achieved this milestone in 2001 for her powerful and moving performance as Leticia Musgrove in the film "Monster's Ball." This victory marked a significant moment in Hollywood history, as it recognized the talent and contribution of African-American actresses in the industry.
